result.execSummary:
The defendant Modesto Javier Melendez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. All court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; All applicable fees of supervision. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Restitution set at $0 (zero).

superMiscConds.notes: - Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.

- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- No possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- NO CONTACT with: Thomas T., Seng T.
- No possession of any "bump keys."
- No driving without a valid driver's license or insurance.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

Per Remittitur dated August 26, 2019, Appeal No. 2017AP001904-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on July 17, 2019, that: 
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney David Del Busto is relieved from further representing Modesto javier melendez in this appeal.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

records.addlTxt: per order dated March 4, 2019, Appeal No. 2017AP1904-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that this appeal is held in abeyance pending a decision by the Wisconsin Supreme Court in State v. Trammell, No. 2017AP1206-CR, unpublished slip op. (WI App May 8, 2018).
No Merit Report Pursuant to Rule 809.32(1), received.

per order dated September 22, 2017, Appeal No. 2017XX1061CR, IT IS ORDERED that within five days of the date of this order, the clerk of the circuit court, under Wis. Stat. Rule 809.11(2) (2015-16) shall transmit the "Notice of No-Merit Report" because it is actually a notice of appeal. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion to extend the time for for filing a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is denied. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion to extend the time for filing a no-merit notice of appeal and no-merit report is denied as unnecessary. By rule, the deadline for filing the no-merit notice of appeal and the no-merit report is November 20, 2017.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State complied with victim notification.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  60 MONTHS with 613 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 30 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, random screens.
-No possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- No contact with: Thomas T., Seng T.
- Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.
-No possession of any "bump keys."
- No driving without a valid driver's license or insurance.
- Provide a DNA sample.

Restitution is set at $0 (zero); 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS. Case calendared for sentencing. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

 On the same day, at the hour of 2:42 p.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson, brought in a verdict as follows:
.
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Modesto Javier Melendez, GUILTY of Operating a Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, as charged in the Information.  Dated this 19 day of October, 2016, Foreperson."
.
The Court polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed.  Court discharged the jury.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Filed, Exhibit List. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Jury in at 1:16 p.m.

Trial continued.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 1:50 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputy D. Rutter who was duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Court held in court discussion with the defendant as to right to wear jury clothing.
 
Jury in the box at 9:41 a.m. Trial continued. City of Milwaukee Police Officer Ruben Cordova still under oath for the state: State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 9:48 a.m. Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court held colliquy with the defendant as to his right to testify or not to testify. Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and knowingly reserves his right to testify.  Sworn for defense: Modesto Javier Melendez. Jury in the box at 10:05 a.m. Court instructed jury defendant sworn. Defense rests. State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 10:25 a.m.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court. Open court discussion amongst parties as to jury instructions put on the record. For reasons further stated on the record,  Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 37.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Court held open court colliquy with the defendant as to possible competency concerns. Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly acknowledging his competent mind set to proceed with jury trial.

Jury in the box at 3:07 p.m. Court instructed jury.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly sworn.
Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn as Hmong interpreter: Pahoua Xiong. Sworn for the state: Thomas T., Seng T., City of Milwaukee Police Officers Bradley Johnson and Ruben Cordova. Exhibit #'s 1, 2 and 3 offered and received from the state. Exhibit # 5 offered, received and published to the jury from the state. Exhibit #'s 4, 6 and 7 offered and received from the state.  Jury excused for the evening at 4:51 p.m.   Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 37.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

Jury panel in court at 10:20 a.m.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 10:41 a.m.    
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed. Jury excused for lunch at 11:47 a.m. Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 37. In chambers discussions as to jurors being stricken put on the record in open court. Court has discussion with the defendant as to his jury trial posture and behavior during trial juncture. State addresses concerns with the Judge as to defendant's in court behavior and declining of jury clothes. Court gives further instructions to the defendant in open court.  Jury trial scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Modesto Javier Melendez not in court, in custody in the bullpen and not produced.  Daniel Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for jury trial. For reasons stated on the record by the Court,   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 37.
  Jury trial scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for jury trial. For reasons stated on the record, 

-CASE PASSED TO 1:30 P.M.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Modesto Javier Melendez not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea Hearing.  Parties engaged in new negotiations; new offer given today.  Defense request for adjourned dated granted.  Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Modesto Javier Melendez not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations; defense awaiting offer.  Defendant facing revocation proceedings.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Defendant Modesto Javier Melendez in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #11CF4447 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Bradley Johnson-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
